events.title: Formation of Simple Molecules
events.description: The 'primordial soup' theory posits that early Earth's environment facilitated the formation of simple molecules, leading to the RNA world hypothesis.

events.title: Emergence of Protocells
events.description: Protocells encapsulating self-replicating RNA and metabolic networks likely originated in hydrothermal vents or tidal pools.

events.title: Mesopotamian Gender Roles
events.description: Rigid gender roles were enforced through legal systems like the Code of Hammurabi, confining women to limited rights.

events.title: Greek and Roman Gender Norms
events.description: In ancient Greece and Rome, gender roles were defined with men in public life and women in domestic roles, although variations existed such as in Sparta.

events.title: Feudal System and Church Influence
events.description: The feudal system and the Church reinforced traditional gender roles, yet figures like Joan of Arc and female saints challenged these norms.

events.title: Women in Religious Authority
events.description: Women like Hildegard of Bingen held significant spiritual authority within convents, challenging the uniformity of patriarchal structures.

events.title: Rise of Humanism
events.description: Women scholars like Christine de Pizan advocated for women's education, laying groundwork for future gender equality movements.

events.title: Enlightenment and Reason
events.description: The Enlightenment's emphasis on reason and individual rights contributed to questioning and dismantling traditional gender roles.

events.title: Shifts in Labor and Family Structures
events.description: Economic changes began to alter family structures and women's roles in labor, setting the stage for future labor movements advocating for gender equality.

events.title: Digital Activism
events.description: Movements like #MeToo utilized social media to raise awareness about gender-based violence, highlighting the potential of digital activism.

events.title: COVID-19 Impact
events.description: The pandemic exacerbated existing gender inequalities, particularly in the labor market, emphasizing the need for policies addressing these disparities.
